intro: Heterotheca viscida, commonly known as sticky fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its sticky, glandular hairs that cover its stems and leaves, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces yellow flowers with ray florets that bloom in late summer to early fall. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert and semi-desert environments. Heterotheca viscida is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads.
